body_html:
I'm slowly running out of ideas. If you have tensorflow installed, please pip uninstall it.

Also, report the output of

declare -x

You could try to use the docker file and build in a docker environment, roughly speaking:

cd tensorflow/tools/docker
sudo docker build -t tfbuild  -f Dockerfile.cpu-devel
sudo docker run -it -v /tmp:/tmp tfbuild bash
cd /tmp
git clone ....

and build from source there.

I have to ask -- are you sure you are building in the right directory?

body:
I'm slowly running out of ideas. If you have tensorflow installed, please `pip uninstall` it.

Also, report the output of

```
declare -x
```

You could try to use the docker file and build in a docker environment, roughly speaking:
```
cd tensorflow/tools/docker
sudo docker build -t tfbuild  -f Dockerfile.cpu-devel
sudo docker run -it -v /tmp:/tmp tfbuild bash
cd /tmp
git clone ....
```
and build from source there.

I have to ask -- are you sure you are building in the right directory?
